heading: Kuhn-Tucker conditions
text: Consider nonlinear minimization maximization problem function \(f : \mathbb{R}^n \times \mathbb{R}^q \\mathbb{R}\) depends \(n\) decision variables \(q\) parameters, subject :\(k\) equality constraints \(h_i : \mathbb{R}^n \times \mathbb{R}^q \\mathbb{R}\), \(m\) inequality constraints \(g_j : \mathbb{R}^n \times \mathbb{R}^q \\mathbb{R}\).

heading: Maximization
Minimization
First-order conditions
text: \(\displaystyle \frac{\partial \mathcal{L}}{\partial x_l} (x_{1}^{*}, \ldots, x_{n}^{*}; p_1, \ldots, p_q; \lambda_{1}^{*}, \ldots, \mu_{m}^{*}) = 0\).\(\displaystyle \frac{\partial \mathcal{L}}{\partial \lambda_i} (x_{1}^{*}, \ldots, x_{n}^{*}; p_1, \ldots, p_q; \lambda_{1}^{*}, \ldots, \mu_{m}^{*}) = 0\).
